programme.title: Women's Individual QFs/SFs/Finals - Archery | Tokyo 2020 Replays
programme.desc: This event took place on 30/07/2021 at Yumenoshima Park Archery Field, Tokyo. An San (KOR) won Gold, Elena Osipova (ROC) took Silver and Lucilla Boari (ITA) completed the podium.

programme.title: Men's Kayak (K1) Semi-Final & Final - Canoe Slalom | Tokyo 2020 Replays
programme.desc: This event took place on 30/07/2021 at the Kasai Canoe Slalom Centre, Tokyo. It Includes the Kayak (K1) Men Finals and Victory Ceremony. Prskavec (CZE) claimed the Gold, Grigar (SVK) took the Silver and Aigner (GER) completed the podium.

programme.title: Racing Semi-Finals & Finals - Cycling BMX | Tokyo 2020 Replays
programme.desc: This event took place on 30/07/2021 at the Ariake Urban Sports Park and includes the Women's and Men's Semifinals, Finals and their Victory Ceremonies. In the Women's final, Bethany Shriever (GBR) won Gold, Mariana Pajón (COL) Silver, and Merel Smulders (NED) Bronze. In the Men's final, Niek Kimmann (NED) took the Gold medal, Kye Whyte (GBR) Silver and Carlos Alberto Ramírez Yepes completed the podium.

programme.title: BRA v ESP - Men's Gold Medal Match - Football | Tokyo 2020 Replays
programme.desc: This match took place on 07/08/2021 at the International Stadium Yokohama, Yokohama. Brazil claimed Gold with a 2:1 victory after extra time against Spain.

programme.title: Meet coach Matthew Booth
programme.desc: Meet Olympic hero and star coach of the Olympic Channel’s The Z Team, Matthew Booth.

programme.title: Can an Olympic legend turn around Hout Bay's football team?
programme.desc: Team South Africa Olympic footballing legend Matthew Booth tries to turn around the fortunes of a struggling local football team.

programme.title: SWE v CAN - Women's Gold Medal Match - Football | Tokyo 2020 Replays
programme.desc: This match took place on 06/08/2021 at the olympic Stadium, Tokyo. Canada claimed the Gold with a 3:2 Penatly Shoot-Out win over Sweden

programme.title: Men’s Football Final, Rio 2016
programme.desc: Two great football nations, Brazil and Germany, clashed in an epic gold medal final featuring Neymar against twins Lars and Sven Bender.

programme.title: Rubensson, the offensive midfielder for Sweden | World at their Feet
programme.desc: With 75 Caps for Sweden, Olympic Silver Medallist in Rio 2016 Elin Rubensson is a special talent. Growing up in Mariaholm near Malmö, she joined the national team at 19. She participated in the FIFA World Cup 2015 but it’s only in 2019 that the team reached third place, losing against Netherlands in semi-final. Elin could not participate in Tokyo as she gave birth to a little boy. She is now at her best to help Sweden bring home the world title as well as looking ahead for Paris 2024.

programme.title: Kiwi defender who survived it all, ready for World Cup | World at their Feet
programme.desc: Rebekah Stott, who plays for Brighton & Hove Albion in the English FA Women's Super League, is also a veteran of two Olympics and cancer survivor. She was sidelined by her illness and missed Tokyo 2020 but she is now back stronger than ever on New Zealand’s national team and looking forward to an emotional home World Cup as well as becoming a three-time Olympian next summer in Paris.

programme.title: Atletico Madrid's darling is key to Colombia success | World at their Feet
programme.desc: Her parents sacrificed everything to give her a chance to achieve her dream of becoming a professional player. From a farming village in the middle of Colombia to being the best number 10 of her country, Leicy Santos’ story is an amazing journey. She left alone to Bogota at 12 and at 15 years old, she was called into the national team. She participated in Rio 2016 Olympics. After winning the first ever professional women’s championship in 2017 with Santa Fe, in 2019, she was the first ever Colombian Player to be signed for a European team, first Colombian player to score in the Champions League and MVP in 2019/20 for Atletico Madrid. She now targets top 3 at FIFA Women’s World Cup 2023.

programme.title: ‘We’re the Best Team in New York City’ | We Are King
programme.desc: City soccer is very special in New-York City and MLK sits at the top, with 19 titles in 25 years. The team is off to a new season and gunning for its 20th title. Coach Jake and assistant Kamani welcome the team for their first practice and super-pro prospect Carlos Lainez is back from Spain. TThey will soon play the top Ohio State team. After a rough start, the team is taking shape but it’s a 16 match competition before the play-offs begin.

programme.title: ‘The Guy in the Mirror is Usually the One Stopping You’ | We Are King
programme.desc: Carlos Junior, the team captain and best pro prospect has 13 brothers and sisters, 4 are living with him and his dad in the Bronx. A semi-pro club in Spain offered him a contract but he made the promise to Jake and his MLK family to get them that 20th win. Maynor, also from Honduras, is taking care of his disabled mother. After a shaky start to the season, he comes into his own against Upper West Side rival Beacon.

programme.title: BRA v MEX - Men's Gold Medal Match | London 2012 Replays
programme.desc: The Men's Gold Medal Match took place on 11/08/2012 at the Wembley Stadium, London. Mexico claimed the Gold with a 2:1 win against Brazil

programme.title: Men’s Football Final, Rio 2016
programme.desc: Two great football nations, Brazil and Germany, clashed in an epic gold medal final featuring Neymar against twins Lars and Sven Bender.

programme.title: ‘We’re the Best Team in New York City’ | We Are King
programme.desc: City soccer is very special in New-York City and MLK sits at the top, with 19 titles in 25 years. The team is off to a new season and gunning for its 20th title. Coach Jake and assistant Kamani welcome the team for their first practice and super-pro prospect Carlos Lainez is back from Spain. TThey will soon play the top Ohio State team. After a rough start, the team is taking shape but it’s a 16 match competition before the play-offs begin.

programme.title: ‘The Guy in the Mirror is Usually the One Stopping You’ | We Are King
programme.desc: Carlos Junior, the team captain and best pro prospect has 13 brothers and sisters, 4 are living with him and his dad in the Bronx. A semi-pro club in Spain offered him a contract but he made the promise to Jake and his MLK family to get them that 20th win. Maynor, also from Honduras, is taking care of his disabled mother. After a shaky start to the season, he comes into his own against Upper West Side rival Beacon.

programme.title: BRA v MEX - Men's Gold Medal Match | London 2012 Replays
programme.desc: The Men's Gold Medal Match took place on 11/08/2012 at the Wembley Stadium, London. Mexico claimed the Gold with a 2:1 win against Brazil

programme.title: ‘Bacon, Egg and Cheese’ | We Are King
programme.desc: David Reyes Aka D. Dotty is a burly defender but he is juggling soccer and a burgeoning rap career with the need to help his family earn money in a tough Bronx neighbourhood. He often comes late or tired to the pitch. As the team moves up the rankings, Coach Jake is getting nervous and talks about his past troubles with addiction.

programme.title: ‘This is What We Live For’ | We Are King
programme.desc: MLK finally enters the playoffs. Three more games separate the team from their goal but their starting goalkeeper is now suspended. Assistant coach Kimani, both the kids’ chief on-field instructor and off-field confidant, manages to keep the team in balance. His patience combined with Jake’s drive are a perfect match. Defender Vakaba, who has come to New York City to fulfil his dream, joins the team and becomes an essential part of its success.

programme.title: ‘You Not Really about it’ | We Are King
programme.desc: MLK high school has been unstoppable this year. They are about to achieve an undefeated season. But Coach Jake is getting increasingly tense. While some players like Charles are doing great both at school and on the team, others like goalkeeper Raymond are struggling to keep their nerves, putting the whole team at risks. Raymond is trying to live up to the dreams and expectations of his father, a talented goalkeeper himself who never made it pro. Soon the team faces a decisive game which will determine the number one seed in the playoffs.

programme.title: ‘The Only Game that Matter is the Last One’ | We Are King
programme.desc: Can we tell a King player from another player just by his look?. A storybook season must end in storybook fashion. But as MLK is leading in semi-final, top player Carlos get a yellow card against their long-time rivals Beacon. Jake's obsession is now turning into superstition as he makes a final call that will soon turn the team fortune. Maynor, who had seemed to struggle in front of the goal since the start of the season, is proving to be a decisive striker.

programme.title: Women's Football Final | Sydney 2000 | Great Olympic Moments
programme.desc: Watch the greatest Olympic Moments and relive the women's football final in which Norway beats the USA and claims gold during the Sydney Summer Olympic Games in 2000

programme.title: Men’s Football Final, Atlanta 1996
programme.desc: Mighty football nation Argentina in an Olympic final against Nigeria hoping to become the first major football champion from Africa.

programme.desc: Two great football nations, Brazil and Germany, clashed in an epic gold medal final featuring Neymar against twins Lars and Sven Bender.

programme.title: USA v JPN - Women's Gold Medal Match | London 2012 Replays
programme.desc: The women's Gold Medal Match took place on 09/08/2012 at the Wembley Stadium, London. The United States claimed the Gold medal with a 2:1 victory over Japan

programme.title: ‘This is What We Live For’ | We Are King
programme.desc: MLK finally enters the playoffs. Three more games separate the team from their goal but their starting goalkeeper is now suspended. Assistant coach Kimani, both the kids’ chief on-field instructor and off-field confidant, manages to keep the team in balance. His patience combined with Jake’s drive are a perfect match. Defender Vakaba, who has come to New York City to fulfil his dream, joins the team and becomes an essential part of its success.

programme.title: Geyse, Brazil’s shooting star | World at their Feet
programme.desc: Ferreira is a powerful striker who lives to score goals, as reflected by her incredible stats. She can shoot with both feet and few defenders are able to match her phenomenal speed. She is the youngest of a family of six siblings. Spotted by a sport teacher as she was playing on the beach, she would take a 4-hour bus to get to training and back until she was called on U20 national team. She signed for Benfica in 2017 ended up with 49 goals in only 30 games. After 56 appearances and 30 goals in 2 seasons at Madrid CFF, she joined Barcelona in 2022. Tokyo 2020 is the highlight of her international career so far but she is ready to give it all for the Seleção at FIFA Women’s World Cup 2023.

programme.title: Women's Football Final | Sydney 2000 | Great Olympic Moments
programme.desc: Watch the greatest Olympic Moments and relive the women's football final in which Norway beats the USA and claims gold during the Sydney Summer Olympic Games in 2000

programme.title: Deyna Castellanos: breaking gender stereotypes in football | Her Game
programme.desc: When Deyna Castellanos started playing football, her father thought it was a men’s sport. She soon had him change his mind. The Venezuela and Atletico Madrid footballer now uses her influence to ease the path of younger female footballers. Featured song: Ain’t It by Bree Runway

programme.title: Neymar at age 17
programme.desc: Neymar had only just turned professional in 2009 but his outstanding talent ensured he was expected to become a Brazil football legend.

programme.desc: In its second Olympic appearance, Norway's stars are pitted against the USA, consistently the dominant nation in women’s football.

programme.title: Men's Football Final | Rio 2016 | Great Olympic Moments
programme.desc: Relive one of the greatest Olympic Moments and watch as the host Brazil wins the gold medal over Germany in a 5:4 penalty shootout during the men's football final at the Rio Summer Olympic Games in 2016

programme.desc: With 75 Caps for Sweden, Olympic Silver Medallist in Rio 2016 Elin Rubensson is a special talent. Growing up in Mariaholm near Malmö, she joined the national team at 19. She participated in the FIFA World Cup 2015 but it’s only in 2019 that the team reached third place, losing against Netherlands in semi-final. Elin could not participate in Tokyo as she gave birth to a little boy. She is now at her best to help Sweden bring home the world title as well as looking ahead for Paris 2024.

She was sidelined by her illness and missed Tokyo 2020 but she is now back stronger than ever on New Zealand’s national team and looking forward to an emotional home World Cup as well as becoming a three-time Olympian next summer in Paris.

programme.title: Atletico Madrid's darling is key to Colombia success | World at their Feet
programme.desc: Her parents sacrificed everything to give her a chance to achieve her dream of becoming a professional player. From a farming village in the middle of Colombia to being the best number 10 of her country, Leicy Santos’ story is an amazing journey. She left alone to Bogota at 12 and at 15 years old, she was called into the national team. She participated in Rio 2016 Olympics. After winning the first ever professional women’s championship in 2017 with Santa Fe, in 2019, she was the first ever Colombian Player to be signed for a European team, first Colombian player to score in the Champions League and MVP in 2019/20 for Atletico Madrid. She now targets top 3 at FIFA Women’s World Cup 2023.

programme.title: Brand leads a new generation of players for Germany | World at their Feet
programme.desc: Jule Brand is a fast, skillful and versatile midfielder for VfL Wolfsburg who is ready to shine at FIFA Women’s World Cup 2023. She is one of the best young talents in Germany and has the potential to become one of the best in the world.She played football on boys’ team from an early age until she signed for Hoffenheim at 16 years old. She was 14 when the German team won Gold at Rio 2016 Olympics and it inspired her to pursue a professional career. She scored on her first appearance in the national team in 2021 and was selected for Euro 2022 and really made her name on the international stage.

programme.title: Zambia sensation ready to strike at World Cup | World at their Feet
programme.desc: Barbra Banda, Zambia’s national team striker, made Olympic history at Tokyo 2020, being the first player — man or woman — to score three goals in back-to-back games. She is probably the greatest football talent in the country, inspiring a whole generation of young women. She began playing on the streets of Lusaka where it was taboo for women to play football. She ended up joining one of the biggest clubs, the Green Buffaloes, before being the first player in Zambia to play in Europe followed by Super League club Shanghai Shengli where she is the top scorer. She is now ready to lead her nation in their first ever World Cup.
